result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen G McCuen

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 6, 2022 at 11:15 am.

10:03 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Allen G McCuen. Defendant Allen G McCuen appeared by video, in custody from Pierce County Jail. 

Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas, received by court.

Court orders 20 days for motions to be filed which can be extended for good cause.

Status Conference set for 12/06/2022 at 11:15 AM (set in court)

1:31 PM case called and held via Zoom. Defendant Allen G McCuen appeared by video, in custody in Pierce County.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Allen G McCuen.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
State calls Deputy Olson to testify- is sworn and testifies. State offers Exhibit #1- Received by the court. Record to reflect identification of the defendant by Deputy Olson. 
Cross-examination by the Defense. Witness is excused. 
State argues for bind over. Defense makes argument against bind over. 
Court binds matter order for ARGN.
Arraignment scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:51 AM case called and held via Zoom. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Allen G McCuen appeared by video.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for Allen G McCuen. Defendant ordered to be fingerprinted.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:01 AM Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Allen G McCuen appeared by video, in custody from the Pierce County Jail. Defendant advised of right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:11 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Allen G McCuen appeared by video, in custody without counsel. 
Advised of charges and waives reading of the complaint. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 6/20/22 at 3:30 PM. Return to court: 7/13/22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.

(11:58 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Allen G McCuen does not appear in court or via Zoom.
State advises a summons was issued and not returned to the District Attorney's Office.
State also advises the defendant may possibly be in treatment court in Dunn County.
Court advises will give another chance for the defendant to appear in court.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.
For Initial Appearance on May 26, 2022 at 11 AM.
